intro: Phyllanthus pomifer, commonly known as the milk bush, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, green, fleshy leaves. The plant produces yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has various traditional uses in herbal medicine. Its adaptability to different soil types makes it a resilient species in diverse environments.
